pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.20_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.21.1_0: ‘If, when asked by a nun, a nun consents to resolve a legal issue, but then neither resolves it nor makes any effort to resolve it, then, if there was no obstruction, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.2_0: a certain nun went to the nun Thullanandā and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.3_0: “Please come, Venerable, and resolve this legal issue.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.5_0: but then neither resolved it, nor made any effort to do so.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.6_0: She told the nuns what had happened,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.7_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.14_0: she does not resolve it herself.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.15_0: Nor makes any effort to resolve it:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.17_0: If, thinking, “I’ll neither resolve it nor make any effort to resolve it,” then, by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.8_0: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.1_0: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she does not resolve the legal issue, nor does she make any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.2_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she does not resolve the legal issue, nor does she make any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.3_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she does not resolve the legal issue, nor does she make any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.4_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not resolve the legal issue, nor does she make any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.5_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.6_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.7_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
